page.title: 08TOWYN CHURCH SCHOOL.
page.content: The School was built in{1829}by{LADY {BAMFORD-HESKETH},who was the mother of the Countess of Dundonald,and lived in Gwrych Castle,Abergele. The first headmaster was a{MR.NOAKES} from Devon,who was also the church organist.He did not allow any child to speak{WELSH}in school,and he caned any child that he caught.At that time all the children in the area spoke Welsh and very few could speak English. Lady Bamford-Hesketh gave prizes each year to the best pupils. The school{closed in 1950}and was rehoused as Towyn Junior School on its present site in Morfa Avenue.
